1.52.text: Today I'm going to show you how to make this really cool milk bottle

7.64.text: You can fill it with sweets and candy.

12.42.text: And if you like, you can break it open.

19.48.text: It's the same idea as the chocolate coke bottle i made recently,

26.82.text: and to make it we're going to need an ordinary milk bottle.

35.64.text: give the bottle a good wash out with some fresh clean water,

46.76.text: If you like you can use some kitchen paper to help absorb any moisture.

62.44.text: and keep it to one side because we'll be using this later.

66.56.text: Next we need to put a bowl in to a pan of hot water to make a bain-marie ready to melt some chocolate.

90.54.text: and you should find it slowly starts to melt.

96.14.text: Because of the size of the milk bottle, we're going to need a lot of chocolate so I'm adding a few more slabs.

116.30.text: When it's all melted remove the bowl from the pan,

120.72.text: and sit it on the side for a minute,

123.54.text: then place a funnel in the top of your milk bottle and carefully pour in the melted chocolate.

133.58.text: We want the bottle to be nice and strong so we're going to need quite a lot of chocolate to make a nice thick layer.

146.36.text: Next we need to carefully tilt and rotate the bottle to completely coat the inside.

154.56.text: Make sure the handle is full,

157.46.text: and slowly work your way to the top of the bottle.

170.66.text: sit the bottle down and leave it to dry.

173.86.text: As it's setting we need to regularly spin the bottle to continue building up a nice thick layer inside.

181.94.text: We want the chocolate to be nice and thick to make the bottle nice and strong.

188.58.text: If you need to, you can pour in more melted chocolate.

194.60.text: Once it's completely set, it'll look like this.

199.52.text: And now we need to remove the plastic bottle,

203.66.text: so take a sharp knife and carefully cut off the plastic.

210.84.text: Try not to damage the chocolate with your knife, and if you start down at the bottom the label will cover up any mess.

219.48.text: It is a little tricky but if you go nice and slowly you should find it comes off okay.

226.56.text: I removed the bottom section first,

230.30.text: and the started on then top.

235.74.text: You need to be especially careful around the handle to make sure it doesn't snap.

245.26.text: And there's our finished chocolate milk bottle.

258.16.text: It looks great and most people would think it's just and ordinary bottle of milk.

265.40.text: If you like you can open it up,

267.86.text: and pour in some sweets or candy.

272.08.text: I'm adding a selection of different things so it's a nice surprise.

291.44.text: and there's our finished chocolate milk bottle surprise, Pretty cool, huh?
